paper_abstract: We present a new streaming algorithm for maintaining an epsilon-kernel of a point set in a"e (d) using O((1/epsilon ((d-1)/2))log (1/epsilon)) space. The space used by our algorithm is optimal up to a small logarithmic factor. This significantly improves (for any fixed dimension d a parts per thousand yen3) the best previous algorithm for this problem that uses O(1/epsilon (d-(3/2))) space, presented by Agarwal and Yu. Our algorithm immediately improves the space complexity of the previous streaming algorithms for a number of fundamental geometric optimization problems in fixed dimensions, including width, minimum-volume bounding box, minimum-radius enclosing cylinder, minimum-width enclosing annulus, etc.
paper_title: An Almost Space-Optimal Streaming Algorithm for Coresets in Fixed Dimensions
